page.title: 09Religion-Local Churches
page.content: St.Matthias,the parish church of Ilsham in Babbacombe Road,was built as a chapel of ease to St.Marks Church at Torwood in 1858.In 1880 it became a separate parish.St.Marks Church has now been bought by the Torbay Operatic and Amatuer Dramatic Society and is being changed into a theatre.Holy Trinity is now a sports centre and St.Matthias is now known as St.Matthias,St.Marks and Holy Trinity. St.Matthias has never had a graveyard and a new hall is being built in the grounds.The windows are decorated with stained glass pictures including one of St.Francis of Assissi in the small,dark side chapel.The seats and lectern are nicely carved.There are three alters in the church,one big one and two small ones.One rector looks after all three parishes.
